executive_summary: A 1.5-hour technical session where Bilal creates a comprehensive wastewater treatment plant (WWTP) design calculator in Google Sheets. Work involves merging multiple data sheets, converting flowcharts to formulas, defining variables, and creating visualization guidelines. This is specialized professional engineering work (IAP) requiring deep technical knowledge of wastewater treatment processes.
attention_policies: MOMENTS when complex data needs systematic organization
SPACES where engineering calculations require spreadsheet automation
PATTERNS where technical variables need clear naming and documentation

iaps_identified.description: Creating WWTP design calculator for professional engineering work
iaps_identified.context: Technical deliverable - spreadsheet tool for wastewater treatment plant design
iaps_identified.evidence: Focused 1.5-hour session, specific deliverable (TSV file for Google Sheets), technical precision required

sarec.assessment: Consistent focus on clarity and precision in technical work
sarec.reasoning: Bilal requests clear variable names, explanations of acronyms, and comprehensive documentation
evidence: Requests explanation of acronyms (SOR, etc.): 'Can you update the table to describe what SOR and other acronyms are'
Wants variables not cell references: 'I'd rather have variables rather than things like B6 which mean nothing'
Requires comprehensive details: 'That's a bit minimal, I thought you'd include all the calculations'
Requests visualization guidelines for proper data interpretation

values_extracted.attention_policy: MOMENTS when technical documentation needs to be self-explanatory

evidence: Understands complete WWTP process flow (headworks, primary/secondary treatment, DAF, disinfection)
Familiar with technical parameters (SOR, F/M ratio, SRT, MLSS, PHF, ADF, MDF)
Knows design criteria and industry standards
Requests conversion of flowcharts to spreadsheet formulas
Knows to use named variables for maintainability
Understands data validation and dropdown constraints
Requests specific visualization types (line charts, scatter plots, stacked bars)
Merges multiple data sheets into consolidated format
Structures data with clear hierarchy (Stage, Section, Variable)

characteristics: Breaks complex system into structured components
Requires clear documentation at every step

communication_style.specificity: Very high - precise about what's needed

design_flows.ADF: Average Daily Flow - base design flow

tensions_identified.description: Balance between simple output and comprehensive documentation
tensions_identified.bilals_response: Explicitly requests comprehensive version: 'That's a bit minimal, I thought you'd include all the calculations'
tensions_identified.resolution: Chose comprehensive documentation with full formulas and visualization instructions
tensions_identified.significance: Values completeness over brevity in technical documentation

analyst_notes.significance: This conversation reveals Bilal has advanced civil/environmental engineering expertise, specifically in wastewater treatment plant design. This is specialized professional work (IAP) requiring deep technical knowledge.
analyst_notes.pattern_recognition: Clear IAP pattern - focused technical delivery with specific deliverable. Similar to BMC ERP conversation (#7) but even more specialized. No creative exploration or entrepreneurial energy.
analyst_notes.cap_vs_iap_insight: Unambiguous IAP - professional engineering work with tight technical requirements. Evening timing (20:42-22:18) suggests professional deadline or project work.
analyst_notes.domain_expertise: Advanced WWTP knowledge - understands complete treatment process, design parameters, and industry standards. This is professional-level engineering, not hobbyist or learning.
analyst_notes.connection_to_other_conversations: Third IAP observed (UNESCO Gaza report, BMC ERP, WWTP calculator). Shows Bilal balances professional consulting/engineering work with entrepreneurial projects.
analyst_notes.temporal_context: April 2025 - Professional engineering work ongoing. Evening session suggests deadline-driven or after-hours consulting work.

analysis_metadata.methodology: SAREC Framework with attention policies and Come Alive (CAPs/IAPs)
